comment: Prof McNamara is a very nice lady, but doesn't know how to teach or code at all.  Teaches from book and furnished powerpoints.  I came to learn, but didn't learn much from her.    I stopped paying attention in class.  Just come on test review days and study hard.  I got 95+ on all tests just by cramming.  Very nice lady, not a good teacher.

Prof  McNamara is an excellent professor.  I think she is given a bad rap by those who are just disinterested in the class.  I find her to be fair and extremely helpful.  She does not design the class, KSU does.  I like her teaching  & he real life applications she imparts.  She gives extra credits and understanding  when technology does not work.

Prof McNamara is an excellent teacher.  She cares about her students and always give positive feedback.  Her classes are interesting, even the difficult chapters.   I have taken her  for several classes and I find the topics to be interesting.  She encourages feedback.  I would definitely take her class again.

Professor Mcnamara knows what she's talking about. She has been working in the field of software engineering for a majority of her career, and it really shows in her lectures. Very helpful, giving her student all the tools they need to pass and then some. Tests are not hard as long as you study. Overall as long as you put in effort you will pass.

Professor Mcnamara was extremely helpful in and out of class, often asking the students thier comfort lvl with due dates and such. Best of all she is really helpful during the group project with not letting that one guy in the goup screw over everyone else. alot of powerpoint slides, but thats most classes tbh

She really cares about her students, will help you anyway she can.  Gives extra credit which will help if you do not do well on test.  She gives group projects so you get a feel for what the real world  is like.  Quizzes are online and test are in class short answer and essay. Reviews in class before test and quizzes. Has real world work experience

Professor McNamara is a great professor and very approachable.  She is always willing to help and gives good feed back when asked.  She gives extra credit for attendance and participation, which pushed my grade up by a letter grade. Gives online quizzes and in-class Exams.  She helped me with my resume while applying for my first CS job.   Take Her

Prof. McNamara is by far one of the driest and dullest professors I've ever had. Want to attend a lecture by her? Just grab the most monotone and uninspired person off the streets, hand them a Database textbook, and tell them to pace back and forth and read from it slowly to you. You will learn 100% from the book or from other people in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: McNamara didn't really make ethics any more interesting than it already wasn't. Overall, the class was boring but the material was very easy. No tests, but a lot of writing.

She's a sweet lady, but man is she awful with communication. Although the class isn't difficult you can tell that the other courses she teaches must not be well structured. Lots of discussion posts, random assignments, and no tests - at least for ethics. Great lady, means well, but not the best professor...

Test are mostly essays. Projects are given with little to no direction and when you ask for direction it is still very unclear. These are due usually once per week. It seems more business oriented than IT oriented. Quite a difficult and time consuming class.

Tests were all essay style, gave little to no direction on assignments and projects which were fairly large and due weekly. Class felt as though it should have been part of a business course. Required to use MS Project software but gave no direction on how to use it. One of the most time-consuming classes I've taken.

Class was not the easiest class I have ever taken, but I was interested in the material. Assignments were not difficult or outlandish as other have reviewed. I made a B in the class. Great communication on professors part, will take this professor again.
Not specific on assignments and projects. Large projects due every week. Quizzes ok. Tests are all essayshort answer. One of the hardest classes I've ever had.

classic instructor that expects you to already know the information before you complete the task. She is not forward with her expectations; however, expects that you follow requirements that were not given at the beginning of assignments. Stricktly works out of the text, Tests are almost always T/F and Short Answer. needs double the hours of work
